Jesus walked alone with Peter, for there was something which He wished to communicate to him only. Before His death, Jesus had said to him, "Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards." To this Peter had replied, "Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake" (John 13:36, 37). . . . Peter had failed when the test came, but again he was to have opportunity to prove his love for Christ. . . . Jesus thus made known to Peter the very manner of his death; He even foretold the stretching forth of his hands upon the cross. . . . He felt willing to suffer any death for his Lord (The Desire of Ages, pp. 812-815).
